result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Deandrew Davon Green
Current: 6474 E Lush Vista View, Florence, AZ 85132 United States  (Effective: 09-09-2022)
Prior: 6307 West Kaul Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53218

Defendant Deandrew Davon Green appeared by video.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn appeared by video for Deandrew Davon Green.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah Dahdouh in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for a status conference. Defense informs the court the defendant recently moved out of state. Defense requests a plea and sentencing date.
Case adjourned.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Deandrew Davon Green in court with attorney Corey R. Flynn.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deandrew Davon Green appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests additional time to review discovery and offer with defendant.  Case adjourned, Br. 30.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Court ordered no contact with Timothy V-S, and Co-defendant Williams.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.
  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Deandrew Davon Green in court with attorney Theodore OReilly.  Defendant Deandrew Davon Green in custody.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   All parties appeared by video conference.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
